name: Graduation Send-off
description: Come celebrate our graduates with some Auntie Anne's pretzels and Starbucks coffee to supercharge your studying experience!

name: Student Game Showcase
description:
The Student Game Showcase is an exciting new event highlighting Charlotte's talented and hard-working community of student game developers. Join us for an evening of playing games and celebrating the work of creative and passionate Charlotte students!
 
Interested in having your game at the showcase? Check out the submission instructions and requirements here!
host: The International Game Developers Association at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte

name: Paws for Exam Therapy
description:
Join us and our certified therapy dogs for a study break. They would love to meet you! 
 
https://bit.ly/De-stressSpring2025

name: YLC FORMYL !
description:
You're invited to this years YLC FORMYL!
Guaranteed: dancing, singing, laughter, fun, red carpet interviews, coffee, and pics for the gram
Dress as nice as you want!
BRING YOUR FRIENDS AND SEE YOU THERE!

name: Office of Undergraduate Research Drop-In Hours
description: Stop by any time between 9:00 AM and 11:00 AM on Tuesdays to meet with a member of the OUR Staff. Drop-in hours can be used for but are not limited to: OUR Scholar application feedback, general programming questions, information about external opportunities, and more. Drop-in hours are held in Barnard 109B.

name: Office of Undergraduate Research Drop-In Hours
description: Stop by any time between 9:00 AM and 11:00 AM on Tuesdays to meet with a member of the OUR Staff. Drop-in hours can be used for but are not limited to: OUR Scholar application feedback, general programming questions, information about external opportunities, and more. Drop-in hours are held in Barnard 109B.

name: Weekly Tea Tasting
description: Come join us for our weekly tea tasting to de-stress before finals!

name: Presidents' Leadership Workshop
description:
This workshop will help you learn how to lead your student organization, delegate tasks and authority, and learn about the resources and benefits available to you as a registered student organization. This workshop typically runs 1 hour and 15 minutes, leaving 15 minutes at the end for conversation and questions. Be ready to participate and share the great things your organization is doing!
 
This workshop is required as a part of the annual registration requirements for student organizations.
 
Contact acholula@charlotte.edu for any and all questions regarding this workshop.

name: Donut Stress
description: Come down to Miltimore lobby for a donut and some tips for finals.

name: Late Night Breakfast
description: The Late Night Breakfast is a long-standing UNC Charlotte tradition that happens on the Last Day of Classes. Students come out for a free late-night meal served by University Administrators and Staff before jumping into studying for Final Exams. Bring your dance moves and big appetite!

name: AfroBITS Game Night
description: Join Us at a social game night with AfroBITS! Enjoy fun games, food, and laughter! See you at the last AfroBITS meeting of the semester!

name: Zen before Pen
description: Join CIC for Zen Before Pen, a calming pre-finals event designed to help you unwind, recharge, and restore your mind and body to finish the semester strong. Learn about great wellness resources on campus to support your wellbeing and build your own Zen garden.
host: Center for Wellness Promotion, Center for Integrated Care, Counseling and Psychological Services, J. Murrey Atkins Library, Student Health Center, The Career Center, University Recreation, University Center for Academic Excellence

name: Final Training
description: A Moment of Magic will meet for one last time for the semester. We will be reflecting on our past three years together as a chapter and celebrating all that is yet to happen.
host: A Moment of Magic at UNC Charlotte

name: Formatting and Submitting Your Thesis or Dissertation
description:
Are you planning to submit your thesis or dissertation sometime this or next semester? Attend this session to have all of your questions about formatting, defense, and submission procedures answered! 
These virtual workshops are offered approximately every two weeks and are *essential* for a stress-free graduation.
 
Register for Zoom Link
Presenter: Michelle HypkiPlease note: Our virtual presentations are designed to foster interpersonal interaction, just as a face-to-face meeting would do. For that reason, no digital note-takers, recorders, or other AI-driven programs are permitted in our Zoom workshops. Thank you.
host: The Center for Graduate Life and Learning

name: Founders Day Celebration
description: Join us in celebrating our founders day! This event open to all is meant to bring together the community.
host: Corazones Unidos Siempre Chi Upsilon Sigma National Latin Sorority, Inc.

name: Reading Day Study Session
description: Happy Reading Day! Join ASME for a study space, some snacks, drinks and relieve some stress before finals week!
host: American Society of Mechanical Engineers at UNC Charlotte

name: Our Impact
description: Join us for this special end-of-year event that will highlight the dedication, hard work, and growth of our members through an engaging presentation showcasing our initiatives and their impact on the community! We’ll recognize outstanding members, reflect on our collective success, and enjoy an evening full of connections, activities, and great food!
host: Latinos for Action, Change, and Empowerment

name: Jamil Niner Student Pantry: Tuesday Volunteer Shift  |  10:30am – 12:45pm
description:
Volunteer Shifts:
The Jamil Niner Student Pantry assists UNC Charlotte students and faculty/staff who are having challenges accessing food regularly. Through volunteering, you will be working with the pantry leadership team to provide healthy, culturally appropriate, and emergency foods to students, faculty, and staff on campus. Volunteer activities may include, but are not limited to: checking shoppers in and out, assisting with pantry upkeep, stocking and sorting food, garden work, and other various activities to help run the pantry. Please wear closed-toed shoes and comfortable clothing when volunteering at the food pantry. Enter through the front door and proceed to the conference room for volunteer check-in. 
If you are unable to stay for the duration of the volunteer shift, please notify a team member before leaving your shift. 
Questions? Email ninerpantry@charlotte.edu.

name: LEGENDARY GAME NIGHT
description: LEGENDARY GAME NIGHTS is the ultimate Friday night hangout where students come together to laugh, compete, and connect. Whether you're new on campus or just looking to meet fun, amazing people, Game Night is the perfect place to make new friends and be part of something bigger. No sign-up needed—just show up, bring good vibes, and get ready to make your college nights legendary. Hosted by the Legendary Club.

name: Dua and dinner
description: Prayer for exams and food

name: Nikao College Small Groups Game night
description: Join us for game night, vibes , and food!

name: Accountability Groups Spring 2025 - Tuesdays at 4:00
description:
<!--StartFragment -->
Ever heard of body doubling?
Body doubling, also known as parallel working, is a productivity strategy where two or more people work on something independently but in the same space. Some students find they are better able to focus and get more done when they are studying alongside someone else studying.
 
What are Accountability Groups?
Accountability Groups meet weekly for 75 minutes and are facilitated by student leaders. The groups are designed to capitalize on the idea of body doubling by helping members practice productive study habits, connect them with peers, and provide dedicated time to work on individual tasks.
 
Join an Accountability Group through Connect! You can sign up as the semester goes on or ask to be placed in the same group weekly.
 
The group that meets on Mondays at 5:30pm is reserved for students with ADHD and ADHD-like experiences.
<!--EndFragment -->

description:
test

name: End of Year Gala
description:
👉RSVP ON EPICHIREJoin us for an unforgettable night at our End of Year Gala as we celebrate a successful year with the Charlotte Sales Network! This formal event is the perfect way to wrap up the year—enjoy great food, music, and company while reflecting on our achievements and looking ahead to the future.
📅 RSVP details will be announced on our social media—stay tuned!👥 You’re welcome to bring a plus one🎩 Dress code: Formal attire
Don’t miss out on this special night of celebration and connection!

name: Write Now!
description:
Are you working on a piece of writing? Could you benefit from some extra accountability and motivation to make progress? Then join us for Write Now!Modeled on the popular Shut Up and Write! program, each Write Now! session features two hours of structured writing time for you to focus on making progress on your writing. Participating in structured writing times benefits graduate and postdoctoral writers by allowing them to strengthen writing habits, make meaningful progress on writing projects, and improve attitudes about writing (Cayley et al., forthcoming; Tremblay-Wragg et al., 2021).Whether you're writing an article, working on a dissertation chapter, preparing to defend your thesis, or just trying to get some work done, Write Now! is right for you!Facilitator: Caitlin BrabbleRose
Register Here
host: The Center for Graduate Life and Learning

name: Alcoholics Anonymous (AA) Meeting
location: Waddell Center for Student Health and Wellbeing Room 107
description: The Charlotte Recovery program hosts an alcoholic anonymous (AA) meeting on campus. This meeting is for anyone dealing with alcohol misuse or addiction, following a 12-step program model. Open to all students and people in the Charlotte community.
host: Center for Wellness Promotion, Health and Wellbeing

name: Test Event 4
description: Testing

name: Annual Health Psychology Research Showcase
description:
Hello!
We are so very excited for the second Annual Health Psychology Research Showcase.  This is a half-day showcase in which the faculty and students of the Health Psychology Ph.D. program will give poster presentations on their work.
This showcase will also feature a panel of Alumni who will share their experience in the program and both their academic and professional trajectories. 
Refreshments will be provided. 

 
This event is meant to be fun! This is intended to be a low-stakes celebration of our program and the work we do! This showcase helps open the floor for collaboration across members of the program and to share the work we do with those interested in Health Psychology. This showcase provides space to engage with members in our program and community in a fun way! This will also provide an excellent opportunity for students to practice giving poster talks, receive feedback, and for prospective students to see what this program is all about. This event will be held on campus, at the Student Union in rooms 262 (panel) and 261 (posters and refreshments). Please RSVP to this event!

name: Laurel's Last Scoop
description: Laurel Hall's End of Year Social

name: Closing Floor Meeting
description: Join us for our final floor meeting of the year as we cover everything you need to know about the move-out process! We'll review important dates, check-out procedures, cleaning expectations, and how to avoid common fees. This is your chance to ask questions, get organized, and ensure a smooth transition as we wrap up the semester. Attendance is highly encouraged to make your move-out stress-free!

name: Undergraduates: Lee College of Engineering Academic Experience Annual Survey
description:
Undergraduates in the College of Engineering, please consider taking a few moments to complete the brief college's annual student "Academic Experience" survey.  This survey is open to all undergraduates enrolled in the Lee College of Engineering and will be available until 5/13.
We value your thoughts and feedback about your educational/academic experiences in the college. 
This is a general link, and no personal data is being collected.  You may use the anonymous link to access the survey. You may also copy and paste it into the browser of your choice.  
 https://surveys.qualtrics.charlotte.edu/jfe/form/SV_3giGjFZHZimGtim
We thank you for your time.

name: Wawa study fuel
description: The WAWA study Fuel is a fantastic academic support and wellness initiative aimed at helping residents stay focused and energized while they hit the books. The goal of this program is to foster a productive and stress-free study atmosphere by offering quiet, dedicated study spaces along with healthy snacks and personalized assistance. Residents can book study rooms during those hectic academic times, and the RA on duty will bring snacks and drinks right to them—giving them the brain fuel they need and a little extra motivation to keep pushing through. It’s a straightforward yet powerful way to enhance motivation, prevent burnout, and cultivate a supportive academic community right in the residence hall.

name: College of Engineering Senior Design Expo   Friday, May 2
description:
Students, we encourage to STOP BY to see what your future holds!  Great an insider's look into this program and the expectations. 
We will have nearly 100 projects on display. During the Expo, you will observe how our students, industry partners, and research departments work together to solve design problems. 
Projects on display will also include department and competition projects from the Mechanical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Engineering Technology departments.
- First-semester students will present a poster showcasing the design work they have done, while second-semester students will display the results of their design implementations.
The event will be held at UNC Charlotte, Barnhardt Student Activity Center, inside Halton Arena, from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM.  Friday, May 2nd  
Learn more at: Senior Design Program - William States Lee College of Engineering  and at
 Engineering Senior Design Expo - University of North Carolina at Charlotte

description: Pop into Student Involvement and enjoy popcorn!

name: Election Speeches + Movie Night
description:
IN DENNY 106!!
If you are interested in running, please:

Fill out our Google Form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSenLzviXbEAC8pqpIGjOFuIVQDUwrN37EIPqB2IzpBIAK4Heg/viewform?usp=sharing ) to submit a typed speech and get your name on the ballot
Give an in-person speech if you are able. We will add names to the ballot up until the end of the meeting

Voting will occur via Google Form after the meeting
If you are interested in seeing the next PRISM executive board, please come and hear the speeches, and after the speeches, we will watch a show together!

name: Quinceanera
description:
A Quinceañera is a traditional Latin American celebration that marks a young woman's 15th birthday, symbolizing her transition from childhood to adulthood. This event is deeply rooted in culture, family, and community.
We invite student to come out on April 29th at 7pm in SAC Salons A-E to enjoy a fun night of music, dancing, and fun!

name: 49er UP/Urban Studies Minor Movie End-of-Semester Movie Screening
description: The 49er Urban Planners Club and the Urban Studies Minor are hosting an end-of-semester movie night! See details below:Tuesday, April 29  |  McEniry 401  |  5:30PM – 7:00PMPopcorn and beverages provided!The film: Why We Walk (2024)Why We Walk is an award-winning documentary that follows the journey of three Black men, from across the globe, united to empower and de-stigmatize urban communities of color and their participation in the great outdoors. After years of city exploration, The Urban Hikers strive to introduce the power of walking to a community that has historically been underrepresented in this space.View the trailer here: https://www.whywewalkfilm.com/trailerWe hope you can join us next Tuesday!

name: Jamil Niner Student Pantry: Tuesday Volunteer Shift  |  2:30pm – 5:15pm
description:
Volunteer Shifts:
The Jamil Niner Student Pantry assists UNC Charlotte students and faculty/staff who are having challenges accessing food regularly. Through volunteering, you will be working with the pantry leadership team to provide healthy, culturally appropriate, and emergency foods to students, faculty, and staff on campus. Volunteer activities may include, but are not limited to: checking shoppers in and out, assisting with pantry upkeep, stocking and sorting food, garden work, and other various activities to help run the pantry. Please wear closed-toed shoes and comfortable clothing when volunteering at the food pantry. Enter through the front door and proceed to the conference room for volunteer check-in. 
If you are unable to stay for the duration of the volunteer shift, please notify a team member before leaving your shift. 
Questions? Email ninerpantry@charlotte.edu.

name: Link for: Annual Student "College Culture" Survey
description:
Please consider taking a few moments to complete the college's annual student "College Culture" survey.  The survey is open to all students enrolled in the College of Engineering and will be available until 4/13 for you to complete.
We value your thoughts and feedback about a few areas pertaining to your educational experiences in the college. 
This is a general link, and no personal data is being collected.  You may use the anonymous link to access the survey. You may also copy and paste it into the browser of your choice.  
https://surveys.qualtrics.charlotte.edu/jfe/form/SV_3eNEX9i2wGcWCWy
Any information about your participation, including your identity, is completely confidential. You will not be personally identified in any reports that are generated as a result of your participation. Your privacy is protected under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Action of 1974 (FERPA).
The college thanks you for your time and we truly hope you will consider completing the survey.

name: Reading Day Refuel
description:
Join Atkins Library and the Jamil Niner Pantry for Reading Day Refuel! Stop by our table outside the library and pick up some healthy snacks. Fuel your body and brain so you can be on your A-game for exams this semester.
 
https://bit.ly/De-stressSpring2025
host: Jamil Niner Student Pantry, J. Murrey Atkins Library

name: Pacific Rim - Society of Systems Engineers Movie Night
description: Join SSE as we unwind before finals with a movie night! We'll be watching Pacific Rim on Monday, April 28th, starting at 7 PM and going until the end of the movie in Cameron 153. Free snacks, good vibes, and giant robots. Don’t miss it!

name: Charlotte Grad Green Out
description: Join us as we ride the light rail and explore SouthEnd and it's abundant summer Farmers Market with your fellow Graduate students! This is a wonderful was to get to explore Charlotte with your neighborhood Niners, and find fun summer spots to unwind or study as the semester winds down. This event is completely free, as is the light rail! The first 50 who register will receive a free $10 voucher to help purchase produce from the market, completely chosen by you! (Light rail directions will be emailed to those who register.) Register at this link.
host: Charlotte Green Initiative, Graduate & Professional Student Government

name: Boots On The Ground - End of Semester Party
description: Celebrate the end of the semester with us with Boots on the ground ! 🎉Live DJ, good vibes, and free snacks you don’t want to miss it! Happening May 2, 2025, from 6:30–9 PM in Cone After Hours!🥳⭐️
host: Building Black Students, Gold Steppaz Line Dancing Organization , Omega Psi Phi Fraternity Inc, Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc

location: Waddell Center for Student Health and Wellbeing Room 107
description: The Charlotte Recovery Program invites students to attend SMART Recovery meetings to support students facing addictive or problematic behaviors using an evidence-based approach. Open to all students!
host: Center for Wellness Promotion, Health and Wellbeing

name: Intersectional Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
description: Weekly meetings to discuss and plan ways to educate, understand, and act on our issues. Our current issue is immigration. We want to understand how UNCC and Charlotte feel about immigration and the problems and conflicts surrounding immigration. We then want to take this information and educate the community and act to solve issues.
host: Intersectional Justice Alliance at UNC Charlotte

name: Intersectional Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
description: Weekly meetings to discuss and plan ways to educate, understand, and act on our issues. Our current issue is immigration. We want to understand how UNCC and Charlotte feel about immigration and the problems and conflicts surrounding immigration. We then want to take this information and educate the community and act to solve issues.
host: Intersectional Justice Alliance at UNC Charlotte

name: ACM Weekly Meeting
description:
For Spring 2025, ACM will meet every Wednesday evening in Woodward 154 from 5:30 to 7:00. Students and prospective members should always feel free to drop in late or leave early as needed.
During the first half of our meeting, we usually spend some time socializing and checking in with our peers, since networking is such an important professional skill to develop. For the rest of the time, we'll look at programming/coding problem together and split into pair programming groups to try and come up with solutions collaboratively. We will also set aside some time to discuss current topics and interests in tech and/or spend additional time workshopping resumes or interview skills with our peers.

name: Monday Night Community Group
description:
Community Groups are a weekly rhythm for college students to exist in community with one another in two different ways:
Family Nights are a time for believers to gather together and worship God through encouragement, song, scripture, and prayer.
Mission Nights is a fun, informal environment that allows Mercy College to invite their non-Christian friends into a community, engage them with the gospel, and model for them what it means to be transformed by the gospel.
 
Join our Monday Night Community Group GroupMe for weekly details on where we will be meeting!
https://groupme.com/join_group/102372594/uB5HkLbEJoin our main GroupMe or follow us on Instagram to keep updated with what is going on in Mercy College!https://groupme.com/join_group/44492399/rkFmYyhttps://www.instagram.com/mercycollege/

name: End of Year Meeting Featuring Social Premise
description: Join us for our final meeting of the '24-'25 year featuring Social Premise who will be performing at 7:00pm

name: Version control with Git
description: Do you struggle to keep track of research files, code, or coursework? Learn how Git can help you stay organized, avoid mistakes, and collaborate with ease. Join us for a beginner-friendly introduction to Git and discover how version control can make your work smarter — not harder!

name: End of Year Meeting Featuring Social Premise
description: Join us for our final meeting of the '24-'25 year featuring Social Premise who will be performing at 7:00pm

name: Accountability Groups Spring 2025 - Mondays at 5:30
description:
Ever heard of body doubling?
Body doubling, also known as parallel working, is a productivity strategy where two or more people work on something independently but in the same space. Some students find they are better able to focus and get more done when they are studying alongside someone else studying.
 
What are Accountability Groups?
Accountability Groups meet weekly for 75 minutes and are facilitated by student leaders. The groups are designed to capitalize on the idea of body doubling by helping members practice productive study habits, connect them with peers, and provide dedicated time to work on individual tasks.
 
Join an Accountability Group through Connect! You can sign up as the semester goes on or ask to be placed in the same group weekly.
 
This group that meets on Mondays at 5:30pm is reserved for students with ADHD and ADHD-like experiences.

name: CAPS Help Desk
location: Atkins; First Floor Atrium (Near the back)
description:
Need someone to talk to? We’re here for you. Join Atkins and CAPS for a brief, informal talk; no appointment needed. We're here to listen and support you. Swing by and talk to us today – we're just a conversation away.
 
https://bit.ly/De-stressSpring2025
host: Counseling and Psychological Services, J. Murrey Atkins Library

name: Charlotte Recovery Program Hangout
location: Waddell Center for Student Health and Wellbeing Room 107
description:
The CRP invites students on campus to relax, connect, and explore recovery support. This is an opportunity to meet new people and learn about CRP.
Open to all students!
host: Center for Wellness Promotion, Health and Wellbeing

name: End-of-Year Celebration
description:
Join the Commercial Real Estate Society for our highly anticipated End-of-Year Celebration, proudly sponsored by Insite, who will also deliver the keynote address. This special event will feature an insightful discussion on diverse topics within the real estate industry, providing attendees with invaluable knowledge and perspectives.
We'll take a moment to honor our graduating members, celebrating their academic achievements with the presentation of cords and stoles. Additionally, we'll shine a spotlight on those who have successfully secured full-time positions or internships in the field—an acknowledgment of their hard work and dedication.This is more than just a celebration; it's an incredible networking opportunity. Attendees will have the chance to connect with our distinguished keynote speaker and notable figures within Charlotte's thriving commercial real estate market, many of whom have been integral to the Society's events throughout the year.Don't miss this remarkable occasion to learn, celebrate, and build meaningful connections in the industry. See you there!

name: NC Bioblitz
description:
Between Friday through Monday (April 25th-28th) the Biology, Pollinator, Mycology and Birding club will be hosting a BioBlitz in the botanical gardens! We will be surveying taxa to measure biodiversity within a certain area.
 
The Pollinator club and Birding club: Saturday, April 26th at 10 am
The Biology Club: Saturday, April 26th at 12 pm
The Mycology Club: Monday, April 28th at 4:30 pm
 
 
 
 
 
***Please download the iNaturalist app to participate!
host: Biology Club of UNC Charlotte, Charlotte Birding Club, Pollinator Club, The Mycology Club of UNC Charlotte

name: Presidents' Leadership Workshop
description:
This workshop will help you learn how to lead your student organization, delegate tasks and authority, and learn about the resources and benefits available to you as a registered student organization. This workshop typically runs 1 hour and 15 minutes, leaving 15 minutes at the end for conversation and questions. Be ready to participate and share the great things your organization is doing!
 
This workshop is required as a part of the annual registration requirements for student organizations.
 
Contact acholula@charlotte.edu for any and all questions regarding this workshop.
